issues.description: The method checkOrderReady() is specified to return void in the problem statement UML (line 32) and description, but the solution implementation declares it to return boolean (SealSaloon.java line 20). This return‐type mismatch could confuse students about the expected signature and prevent them from matching the spec.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the solution with the spec by changing checkOrderReady() in SealSaloon.java to have a void return type, or update the UML and description to specify a boolean return if that is intended.

issues.description: The problem statement instructs to initialize the stock attribute in the SealSaloon constructor (lines 69–74), but immediately after requires that the stock attribute be static (lines 77–80). Initializing a static field in an instance constructor conflicts with standard Java practice and may confuse students about where and how to initialize the shared stock.
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify the problem statement by instructing students to initialize the static stock attribute at the point of declaration or in a static initialization block, rather than in the constructor.
